docs.snippet: The head of the World Zionist Organization called on American Zionists last night to assume a major role in overcoming what he described as the "over-organized chaos" and "bureaucratization" of American Jewish life.
docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the World Zionist Organization called on American Zionists last night to assume a major role in overcoming what he described as the "over-organized chaos" and "bureaucratization" of American Jewish life.
docs.abstract: Goldmann attacks 'bureaucratization' of Amer Jewish life, s, ZOA; says US has only Jewish community in world lacking a repr body; notes other problems facing Jewish orgns

headline.main: ZIONIST ATTACKS 'CHAOS' IN JEWRY; Tells Parley U.S. Jews Lack a Representative Body

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 -- A visit to Venezuela and Colombia in December is tentatively planned by President Kennedy. The White House said tonight a final decision on the trip would be made next week.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 -- A visit to Venezuela and Colombia in December is tentatively planned by President Kennedy. The White House said tonight a final decision on the trip would be made next week.
docs.abstract: Kennedy plans visits to Colombia and Venezuela to dramatize his concern; hails progress, noting $800-million spending already committed, s, inter-Amer Soc and Econ Council; he and Sec Gen Mora sign accord for OAS adm of $6-million development survey

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 -- Secretary of of the Treasury Douglas Dillon warned Latin America today that "the hope of the hemisphere can be betrayed if we assume that the Alliance for Progress is no more than a loan program."
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 -- Secretary of of the Treasury Douglas Dillon warned Latin America today that "the hope of the hemisphere can be betrayed if we assume that the Alliance for Progress is no more than a loan program."
docs.abstract: Dillon warns that Alliance for Progress success depends on Latin Amer development effort, not merely US loans, s, Inter-Amer Econ and Soc Council

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 -- A major spilt in the Organization of American States is expected tomorrow when the organization votes on whether to hold a special foreign ministers' conference to review threats posed by Cuba.

docs.snippet: Under pressure of heavy selling the British pound sterling and Canadian dollar turned weak in the foreign exchange market last week. Continental currencies, on the other hand, showed a strong undertone.

docs.snippet: East German workmen last week erected red-and-white-striped customs barrier gates at the seven crossing points in the wall that divides East and West Berlin. The move clearly was designed to emphasize one of Premier Khrushchev's objectives in...
docs.lead_paragraph: East German workmen last week erected red-and-white-striped customs barrier gates at the seven crossing points in the wall that divides East and West Berlin. The move clearly was designed to emphasize one of Premier Khrushchev's objectives in constructing the stone and barbed wire barricade last summer.

docs.snippet: British, pound sterling and Canadian dollar showed a firmer undertone in foreign exchange dealings last week. Business turnover was very active at times.
